lead_paragraph: KATZ--Alfred J.,M.D., 78, died on January 24, 2016 at his home in Rockville, MD. He is survived by his wife of 43 years Deborah; his daughters, Rebecca Katz (Matt Scharf) and Emily Katz (Laura Chapman), and grandchildren, Olivia, Benjamin, Leo and Eli. Also survived by his sister Miriam Cohen (Herb Cohen); sister-in-law Joan Rosenbaum (John Gorham); nephew Joshua Galper and niece Satya Welch and their families. Born and raised in the Bronx, beloved son of the late Charlotte (Breuer) and Sirol Katz, Dr. Katz was a graduate of the Bronx High School of Science, Swarthmore College, and the University of Pennsylvania Medical School. A Board certified pathologist/hematologist/blood banker, Dr. Katz had a distinguished career at the American Red Cross for more than 30 years, including as Executive Director of Blood Services at National Headquarters. An avid, top-seeded masters tennis player and a man of great intellect who cared deeply about his family and the world around him, his life was guided by high moral and ethical standards. He will be greatly missed. Donations in his memory may be made to the Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research. For further information, contact www.sagelbloomfield.com. 1/3
